text:
I unpublished & archived some pages with a global content module that is also being used elsewhere, restored and published the pages again, and now said module does not have any content or revisions. Any ideas what is up? I luckily had one browser tab open with the old data still available so I could scrape it (there's quite a bit), tried quickly replicating this issue but failed. Quite baffling

Also the module now is somehow of the opinion that it is present on 0 assets even if the module is present on 10 published pages. I had to go to edit and update the pages with the module present for the changes in the global module editor to be reflected on the live side of things.

Hey guys. I have a module named and labelled as "Player". However, under the Content tab of the Edit page (of a page), it's being labelled as "Hero Banner" (2nd module in the image, with the camera icon). I'm not sure what's going on. Any ideas?
it’s named Player in your meta.json file?
Oh yeah, forgot to mention that. Yes, it is named Player there as well.
global search of the module files doesn’t turn up “Hero Banner” anywhere?
(i know this is pedantic…. but due diligence)
It turns up a Hero Banner, but it's pointing to the "correct" Hero Banner (there is actually a module called Hero Banner). I can't find any other reference that points to the Player module
